# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is how you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return lowercase(replace(strip(col), r"[ -]+" => "_"))
end
```
This function uses the `lowercase` and `replace` methods of strings to convert all characters to lower case, remove leading and trailing spaces with the `strip` method, and replace any sequence of one or more spaces or hyphens with a single underscore.
